pullrequest.title: Fix for bullet crashing when mesh shape files cannot be found.

content.raw:
Oh no, I didn't realise that, my bad! Obviously bad place for the test to go then. I've moved it to a new test `InvalidMeshInsertion` in `factory.cc`. 

Good idea about the `SpawnTrimesh` function, though it does actually wait until the model has been loaded (see [here](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ebef2bfd603d4246b0a59b16f0c1374abe19490f/gazebo/test/ServerFixture.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#ServerFixture.cc-1630)), and when we use an invalid mesh, it is not guaranteed that the model will actually added, or is it? Though in practise it is (with an empty mesh), because `World::LoadModel()` is always called from `World::SetState()`...  but in theory it could be that this changes some time later on, and no model is added, or am I wrong?

If the insertion via a setting the world state is not such a great idea, it would of course be possible to use factory messages as well. Maybe the test can wait for a few seconds and make sure it doesn't crash while the model is being added?
content.html:
Oh no, I didn't realise that, my bad! Obviously bad place for the test to go then. I've moved it to a new test InvalidMeshInsertion in factory.cc.

Good idea about the SpawnTrimesh function, though it does actually wait until the model has been loaded (see here), and when we use an invalid mesh, it is not guaranteed that the model will actually added, or is it? Though in practise it is (with an empty mesh), because World::LoadModel() is always called from World::SetState()... but in theory it could be that this changes some time later on, and no model is added, or am I wrong?

If the insertion via a setting the world state is not such a great idea, it would of course be possible to use factory messages as well. Maybe the test can wait for a few seconds and make sure it doesn't crash while the model is being added?
